document.title: Model School Library Standards for California Public Schools, Kindergarten Through Grade Twelve

9158F6099ACD4D3EB653004A897533A9.description: Assess improvement through personal reflection and by reviewing samples of previous work (e.g., portfolio).

4E6CB8A7FDB64F4AB1EA5DB1C599966F.description: Assess the process and the product created (e.g., audio, visual, or written piece of work).

70EAE0F4649F432AB18B78F01D791B06.description: Compare and contrast how literature, theatre, and visual arts from different cultures or time periods convey the same or similar content or plot.

D23B53B2ED994C319A6E5AA6E4C3F4B1.description: Appreciate and respond to creative expressions of information:

06DA47640EA94BF0BC0A25F4CE92D78B.description: Publish online content that is appropriate to the curriculum and personal interests.

A3A38FE3B2714D90B61B57C13C06CCD2.description: Explain how social networks operate and identify issues related to participation and sharing of information.

FA34E976D8E34862AE29B7304D35DDBC.description: Present information collaboratively through a written, audio, or visual format.

ED1637BA48204BCF89F2B512C263A6BC.description: Choose reading from a variety of genres (e.g., drama, fable, fairy tale, fantasy, folklore, essay, speech).

DD78C3F9F76A43A087088B2BA3A73377.description: Read a good representation of grade-level-appropriate text, making progress toward the goal of reading one million words annually by grade eight (e.g., classic and contemporary literature, magazines, newspapers, online information).

8D47E9366CD44E54907DABDCDD7BB891.description: Read widely and use various media for information, personal interest, and lifelong learning:

22AA27F17DDF4BFFA174057A7F59D16D.description: Students integrate information literacy skills into all areas of learning.

E737A322748D46D9ABCDBEF704E40609.description: Utilize online bibliography generation and tracking tools for research projects.

6EA13E15F5EB4D8D924D0C57688577D6.description: Create presentations and documents that demonstrate proper citation and attribution of written, audio, and visual resources used.

68258A4576EC42769BCFA06DF8A9C1D7.description: Create presentations using presentation software or multimedia online applications.

F703320A7B964B1AA0D56629B4CB4E27.description: Use a variety of media (e.g., audio, video, print) to impart information, share opinions, or persuade an audience, or to achieve all those purposes.

6680498723F74CAFB456E59B440CA682.description: Use information and technology creatively to answer a question, solve a problem, or enrich understanding:

B1653D9991FC4C0EAB8AF56B80BE9ED7.description: Present a report visually, orally, or in writing, that conveys a clear point of view with evidence supporting that perspective.

638F1EBEB32B4CA9A9306200749A5819.description: Evaluate evidence to support a proposition or proposal.

DD2E2E2B1CC34FDD92BBCF87D58E8A2B.description: Draw conclusions and make informed decisions:

20203A37135B443595C97F6413128643.description: Understand how to secure wireless devices.

941CFBE16A8943A8AE5E4CC8920FCCBC.description: Understand ethical issues in audio and visual media relating to ownership of content.

8DCA8FDE9E7D445A892CD760A7159AF9.description: Give credit to authors in an acceptable format when appropriate in written and oral presentations, including music and visual content.

FF6F44D9A0EE4341B797CA39F3E5A544.description: Participate in online classroom and/or library discussion groups.

11DF4565D589468E8EF70AD98F45EB82.description: Recognize the consequences of inappropriate and illegal use of information.

5CD9B4B31B534D1481FE738FC930C13F.description: Explain ethical and legal issues related to the use of intellectual property, including print, visual, audio, and online materials (e.g., fair use, file sharing).

AA1B129B5EB94582A7A1C94A9CE11D89.description: Demonstrate ethical, legal, and safe use of information in print, media, and online resources:

2C6C4645DFB94F99B98E1671E821BB0D.description: Modify the research plan as needed.

BEBF7957AF0A4088B2594A8BE452FF33.description: Revise, add, or delete questions as the need for information changes.

9DBC56B362EA45FC9A9D66F0C8D3CF22.description: Consider the need for additional information:

653A7BC39FBD4738A58BF116FFCD2520.description: Evaluate information from visual media as a primary and a secondary source, and distinguish the differences.

937FCF15DEFF4F38A614269F8CB05865.description: Identify and assess evidence that supports ideas and concepts presented in audio and visual media.

FDBE98F06E884A80B807AC6FE6898BA0.description: Assess currency and timeliness in evaluating a Web site and other media.

FBF49EA3004B483CA3A3F3E45AC5B483.description: Evaluate the authority of authors, Web site hosts, and sponsoring organizations of Web sites and print material.

680F1CC2C0AE42E8AA5552D28B0A8B12.description: Analyze differences among various categories of informational materials (e.g., textbooks, newspapers, magazines, atlases, online resources) in terms of structure and purpose.

F8E690011D55412EBD6D857F2D3F387E.description: Evaluate the credibility, comprehensiveness, and usefulness of print, nonprint, and digital information sources.

E30BC5DDB192439BB1B78D4B51FC71BA.description: Assess the comprehensiveness, currency, credibility, authority, and accuracy of resources:

19D9F65A02A240D6B302FB4FA20F4D4F.description: Evaluate sources for fact, opinion, propaganda, currency, and relevance.

77D9F976916D438B9D92669B69F960A6.description: Assess the author's evidence to support claims and assertions, noting instances of bias and stereotypes in a variety of visual and audio materials.

42D047D1D0C749FF8B2ACA14AE02B23C.description: Determine the relevance of the information:

ABAF558AA03943FEBA7318D5437CAAF3.description: Demonstrate effective notetaking, including citation references, quotations, and major points.

8AE46A5B348A4210B9006212A6AF6F6A.description: Use a dictionary to learn the history of common words.

15994B37A73643FC8F2B3398FCFBDD60.description: Identify cues in visual media to assist in retrieving information.

D6647408493C403196C2836DE1FE87CF.description: Explain what the Internet is, how it was created, and how it works.

09A1AFD2CE03437093297DD5F316AD12.description: Demonstrate effective use of digital sources (e.g., navigating within the source, searching one source for a specific topic before searching multiple sources for multiple topics).

AC12DBAD89E141D6AE341A80918CB69E.description: Retrieve information in a timely, safe, and responsible manner:

4C80D626606A41A6A67419607AB3E1DB.description: Understand the differences between search engines and metasearch engines and hierarchical directories.

48752A0B73724C10895608AEA28CC107.description: Use print and online bibliographies and references to identify and locate additional resources.

4FC6EE7F94F049CBAA4EEBEE29D0E03A.description: Use print and/or digital indexes or the search engines of subscription periodical databases to locate information in periodicals and save to an electronic file.

F53FEE6D741242C896ECEDA52FD85018.description: Use indexes online and in print.

0C62BF13C1B14016A522F54B6F438C12.description: Use a variety of encyclopedias and other references to gather information.

E5FB32EF1E5544289D185D0C302E44D7.description: Identify the authority of URL Internet extensions and the potential for bias (e.g., .com, .org, .edu, .gov, .us, .net).

A176C9FC85304EFDA91B4245655BFB44.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the types of resources needed to best answer a question.

2C421F606E07437CA2F85404DB666009.description: Use digital resources to access information beyond the school library collection.

90CC5B1A17D24CDDA7F3271BAD02F706.description: Use an automated library catalog to locate a variety of references and other library resources that support a research question.

E65B7F586460474A911339D8A31EE39A.description: Understand and demonstrate appropriate use of "tags" for online resources.

F4B3DA2C22934FB1B71F6A854C57DF20.description: Develop and use successful search strategies to locate information sources, including primary and secondary sources.

E3420C41441A4072A001FD2551C50797.description: Prioritize sources of information for efficient and effective use.

2AF66046AB2A443B89BF6931F765ADE2.description: Identify scholarly, accurate, and current sources of information in a variety of formats.

434708AB375F4A3CB51898A2C89ABB5B.description: Conduct multistep information searches by using various search strategies to locate digital information that supports research and writing tasks.

B273B7EA60E64572BEA350CFE4DA2F2E.description: Identify and locate a variety of resources online and in other formats by using effective search strategies:

3BC7C9A027634FA9BD9536DBD8BE4F55.description: Create a plan of action for research by defining the topic and identifying key questions, key words, and possible resources.

FAB36D07251D4CE6BF435446E20CEBFF.description: Identify topics and subtopics; ask and evaluate research questions for relevancy.

3950705A297E40DA95BAA568F11E5AE6.description: Establish a hypothesis, a position statement, or both.

64BDF2D82A85419CBC9DEB4702C2E620.description: Recognize the need for specific information in preparing research reports and persuasive compositions and in delivering informative presentations.
